text.p: Deutsche Telekom AG said on Monday that the price range for the roughly 500 million shares in its initial public offering next month would be between 25 and 30 marks ($19.45) apiece.

Telekom also said that it would offer private investors in Germany a discount of 0.50 marks a share on purchases of up to 300 shares. Telekom also said it expected to place between 62 and 67 percent of the initial public offering in Germany. ($ = 1.541 German Marks)
"We are firmly convinced that this price range very closely corresponds to the market's expectations," chief executive Ron Sommer said in remarks released before a news conference.
A final price for the share issue -- the largest ever in Europe -- is expected to be announced on November 16 or 17. The offer is open to subscriptions from October 22 to November 14.

In addition to the approximately two-thirds of the issue being placed in Germany, 13-18 percent have been earmarked for the U.S., Canada and Latin America. A further eight to 12 percent will go to Britain, between five and eight percent to the rest of Europe and a similar amount to the Asia-Pacific.
"With the allocation of one-third of the tranche abroad we will underline the internationality of our flotation," Telekom finance director Joachim Kroeske told journalists.
